dialog: I have a reservation at the Lancaster Suite.
We spoke on the phone when I confirmed yesterday.
Sorry, don't seem to have your reservation.
My family and I would like to be shown to our suite.
You must have made a mistake.
I'm sure you and your lovely family can find other accommodation.
May I suggest you explore Chinatown?
Please, may I use your phone to call my husband?
It's the least you can do.
Mrs. Young, I must ask you to leave or I'll have to call the police.
Lord Calthorpe, my apologies for the disturbance.
Eleanor! I just got off the phone with your husband.
As of this evening, my family's long history as custodians of the Calthorpe is ended.
I'm selling the hotel to my dear friends, the Young family of Singapore.
Meet the new lady of the house, Eleanor Young.
Do get a mop. The floor's wet.
This whole time you had nothing?
All right, so how did I beat T.A. Curtis so very, very badly?
Well, I know for a fact that Curtis is cheap.
So he's not playing using logic or math, but using his psychology.
Our brains so hate the idea of losing something that's valuable to us that we abandon all rational thought, and we make some really poor decisions.
So, Curtis wasn't playing to win.
He was playing not to lose.
All right, that's it for today.
Don't forget your essays on conditional probability are due next week.
Yeah, well, you always say that, and then you end up eating all my dessert.
I don't know what you're talking about.
'Cause I have, like, a tiny bit.
Can we have one more of these, please? Thank you.
So what about us taking an adventure east?
You wanna get pork buns in the East Village.
That's what it is, isn't it?
I was actually thinking of further east.
We've been dating for over a year now, and I think it's about time people met my beautiful girlfriend.
Come on, I'm Colin's best man.
Don't you wanna see where I grew up?
Meet my family, my Ah Ma?
And meet up with that strange college roommate of yours.
She has been begging me to come visit her, you know.
I want the whole island to meet the brilliant Rachel Chu.
"If then you have been raised with Christ, "seek the things that are above "where Christ is seated "at the right hand of God.
"Set your minds on things that are above, "not on things that are on Earth." Eleanor, is Nicki bringing a girl to Colin's wedding?
My Amanda heard it from her friend Francesca.
Eddie says her name is Rachel Chu.
Oh, I thought that Nick was coming alone.
Did you know he had a girlfriend?
Amanda knows everyone and she has never heard of her.
Maybe she's from the Taiwan plastics Chu family.
If you want, I have a private investigator.
I think we should return to the word of God.
"Bring up your children in the discipline "and instruction of the Lord." Oh, I do hope she's a good Christian girl.
Well, if he's bringing her home, it must be serious.
It's my mum. Do you mind?
Does something have to be wrong for me to call?
Are you bringing the girl you're seeing to Colin's wedding?
Mmm. We were literally just talking about that.
We're looking forward to having you home.
And your room is all ready for you.
But Rachel and I will be staying together.
Well, I'm having the house redone.
And it's not ready for guests.
If Rachel comes, I think she might be more comfortable staying somewhere else.
A very small piece at that.
Hey, Mom, this one's kind of cute. What do you think?
No, no! You can't wear that to meet Nick's Ah Ma.
Blue and white is for Chinese funerals.
Now this, this symbolizes good fortune and fertility.
Great! I was really going for that "lucky baby maker" vibe.
Hey! You're the one who asked for my help picking out a dress to meet Nick's family.
It's only 'cause I hardly know anything about them.
Every time I bring them up, Nick changes the subject.
Maybe his parents are poor, and he has to send them money.
That's what all good Chinese children do.
Oh, you're going to have a wonderful time.
You've always wanted to go to Asia.
And who knows, if all goes well in Singapore, you might just come back with a souvenir.
Nick and I haven't even talked about that.
I mean, his parents can't not like me, right?
Nothing. It's just, Nick bringing a girl all the way there to meet them can mean a lot to these overseas families.
I'm so Chinese, I'm an economics professor with lactose intolerance.
Yeah, but you grew up here.
But wearing a lucky color will make a good first impression.
Check our bags, get through security, and then we could eat one of the three homemade Tupperware meals my mom packed for us.
Good afternoon, Mr. Young, Miss Chu.
We'll take your bags and get you checked into first class.
Just go with it. Come on.
Welcome aboard, Mr. Young, Miss Chu.
Here's the way to your private suite.
After takeoff, would you like to enjoy the lounge chairs, or should we convert your suite into a bedroom?
These pajamas are fancier than any of my real clothes.
My family has business with the airline.
"Dim sum." So your family is, like, rich?
That is exactly what a superrich person would say.
It's not a big deal, obviously.
I just think it's kind of weird that I had no idea.
I mean, you have a Jamba Juice card.
You play basketball at that Y that kind of smells.
I really like that place, thank you very much.
And yes, my family has money, but I've always thought of it as theirs.
But I'm going all the way over there to meet them...
Kind of just wanna know what I'm getting into.
And, you know, they're your family.
My family is much like anybody else's.
There's half of them that you love and respect, and then there's the other half.
Well, there's my cousin Alistair, based in Taiwan, works in movies.
He's dating Kitty Pong, an actress.
I was feeling very, very the emotions.
Oh, I can feel all of you.
Okay, and what about your cousin Eddie?
You don't ever talk about him.
Well, Eddie's a big finance guy in Hong Kong.
You know, if you move, it will look more natural.
No, this way you get our optimal angles.
It's an honor to be photographed by you.
People will love it in the next Hong Kong Vogue.
Hong Kong Vogue? I knew it.
If you wore a Bottega gown, like I told you to, we'd be in the American Vogue.
You can wear that gown to Hell, Eddie.
She's like who I wanna be when I grow up.
And she's probably the only one I'm actually close with.
And she's really grounded and down to earth, once you get to know her.
Not only did she graduate top of her class at Oxford, start multiple charities, and is a fashion icon, Astrid has the biggest heart of any of my cousins.
Mummy? See what I made for bunny?
Well, I think BunBun looks very dashing with his bow.
It's very nice to meet you both.
These are all brandnew from Antwerp.
You're the first person I've shown them to.
Set with emeralds, and rare pigeon bloodred rubies.
They were worn by Queen Supayalat at her selfanointed coronation in 1878.
Having you wear one of my pieces is better publicity than I can buy.
I'll let them go at cost.
So if you have all this family there, why are we staying in a hotel?
Aren't good Chinese sons supposed to stay with their parents?
Well, because A, I'm not that good a son.
And B, I just want you to myself, just for a bit.
God, I can't believe this airport has a butterfly garden and a movie theater.
JFK is just salmonella and despair.
It's so nice to finally meet you.
It's so nice to meet you, too.
You guys didn't have to pick us up.
Of course we did. We had to.
Of course I had to come welcome my best man properly.
Oh! Lovely to finally meet you.
Let me help you with this.
I know they're a bit overthetop.
So let's eat everything we can.
Each of these hawker stalls sells pretty much one dish, and they've been perfecting it for generations.
You know, this is one of the only places in the world where street food vendors actually earn Michelin stars.
Long time no see, my friend.
Look at this. Look at this.
I told you. Best satay on the island for sure.
All right, dig in, guys. Oh.
Before I forget, I need your help tomorrow.
I need to do some groomsmen stuff, and I don't wanna do it alone with Bernard Tai.
I still cannot believe that you got that guy to be your groomsman.
Well, it wasn't up to me, was it? It's not my choice.
Bernard is the human douche nozzle who used to steal my tuck shop money when we were kids.
I fell on the floor and the guy sat on me.
So, wasn't really much of a fight.
To my best man, Nick Young, who can't fight for nuts, but will always have your back.
Well, this time next week, guys!
We gotta get over your bachelor party first, matey.
Listen, Rachel, I know we've only just met, but it's my bachelorette party this weekend, and I would love for you to come.
Am I out of the picture?
Am I totally out of the picture?
Yes, I've replaced you with Bernard.
Also, I have to say, I can't remember the last time I saw Nick like this.
He's just happy to be home.
Oh, yeah, he's just happy to be home.
Your dad will be the death of you.
My dad will be the death of me.
Guys, we have to dig in 'cause this crab is not gonna eat itself.
Try some of this. Thank you.
Do you want some of this?
You know what to do. Quickly.
But don't forget, wedding festivities start on Wednesday, so no emergencies next week.
Wouldn't dream of missing a second with your family and their friends.
Come on, it won't be all bad.
Nick and his new girlfriend will be there.
Why? 'Cause she's a commoner like me?
You know that's not what I meant.
You know, I thought I caught the maids trying to shove a pair of Jimmy Choos behind a dryer.
Yeah, I don't know why you bother trying to hide your shopping from me.
You can buy whatever you want.
Besides, everybody knows you wear the money pants in this family.
Oh, I got you something, too.
To celebrate the launch of your startup.
I know you don't like expensive gifts, but you're not a captain in the army anymore.
I'm afraid it's time for me to do some groomsman duties.
I'll get you a breakfast tray.
I told Peik Lin I would meet up with her today.
The whole family's gonna be there.
I can't wait to show you off.
You put those glasses on on purpose.
Oh, my God! You look amazing.
I know. Some things never change, right?
And this is quite a place.
Singapore is so hot. Come in and enjoy the aircon. Come on.
Whole family waiting to meet you. Very excited.
Your house is amazing, Mrs. Goh.
We were inspired by the Hall of Mirrors in Versailles.
Rachel Chu, we are so grateful for all the help you have given my Peik Lin back in her uni days.
I mean, without you, she would be a hot mess.
Actually, if it wasn't for her, I'd be a big mess.
She was a huge help to me in college.
It's nice to meet you, Mr. Goh.
Nice to meet you, too, Chu.
No, I studied in the States, too.
Not at all. Far from it.
Make sure you eat it all.
Ah Pa, can we go trampoline?
You haven't finished your nuggets yet, sweetie.
Okay, there's a lot of children starving in America, right?
I mean, take a look at her.
So, Rachel, what you do in America?
Wow, you must be very smart.
You both went to the same school, yet someone came back with a degree that's useful.
And the other one came back as Asian Ellen.
This is the kind of girl you should date.
Not those like KPop skanks with no brain, big eyes and small backsides.
Pa, she's here with her boyfriend.
I don't see no ring on her finger.
Well, my boyfriend's actually from Singapore and that's why we're here.
We're here to go to his best friend's wedding, where he's gonna be the best man.
This is a very small island.
The Nick you're dating is Nick Young?
You're invited to Colin Khoo's wedding, ah?
Yeah. You guys know them or something?
I mean, who doesn't know who they are?
And Malaysia, Thailand, Brunei, New Mexico.
Colin and Araminta's wedding is Singapore's event of the century.
Tell, tell, what are they like?
I don't really know what they're...
I'm going to Nick's grandma's house.
You're going to Nick's grandma's house wearing this?
Yeah, I thought red was a lucky color, right?
Rachel, these people aren't just rich, okay?
There's new money all over Asia.
We got the Beijing billionaires, the Taiwan tycoons...
But the Young family, they're oldmoney rich.
They had money when they left China in the 1800s.
And they went all the way down here.
They came to Singapore when there was nothing but jungle and pig farmers.
There was a snake here, eating an apple.
And they built all of this.
Now, they're the landlords of the most expensive city in the world. Here you go.
These people are so posh and snobby, they're snoshy.
Yeah, but Nick's not like that.
Even if he isn't, I guarantee you the family is.
Which is why tonight, you need to not look like Sebastian of The Little Mermaid.
You know, the little crab guy?
Look at this guy, he's sleeping.
Come on, this isn't your grandma's road.
Duh. This is like my one chance to see  the Young family mansion.
At the next intersection, make a Uturn.
Are you sure you gave me the right address?
The GPS says there's, like, nothing here.
I don't know why we're here.
I mean, I put in the exact address.
You copied and you pasted it?
Did you just copy and paste "jungle" and just kind of threw it in there?
We're here for the party, and we're...
Do you know where the Young family house is?
I'm here to go to his family dinner.
Uh, Rachel Chu for the list.
Beautiful? It's 200 mil worth of real estate.
Wow! I think I've just fallen in love with you all over again.
What did you get up to?
Oh, uh, this is my friend, Peik Lin.
Thank you very much for bringing Rachel.
Do you wanna stop by for some dinner?
Yeah, I'll fucking come to dinner.
I got to meet Peik Lin's whole family, her dog.
You have a cocktail dress in your trunk?
I thought this was just a family thing.
My grandmother's invited some of her friends over tonight.
The good bathrooms are up the stairs, and you can get changed in there.
You know, when you said you grew up in your grandma's house, I wasn't expecting this.
A little bit much, I know.
I mean, this place is gorgeous.
And like the rolling green hills.
I mean, there are armed guards out there.
Now, my greatgrandfather actually shot him when he ran into the house.
But Astrid and I, we used to hide cigarettes in his paws.
Actually, I wanted to bring you over  to my mum first.
And you look tired from your trip.
I'm gonna ask the cook to make you some herbal soup.
I'll send it to the hotel later.
Oh, my gosh! I'm so happy to meet you, Mrs. Young.
I'm very glad to finally meet you, too.
And I'm sorry Nick's father couldn't be here.
He was called to business in Shanghai.
I told Rachel when duty calls, Dad answers.
Nick tells me you're a professor, too.
Are your parents academics as well?
No. Well, my dad actually died before I was born, and my mom didn't even go to college.
She actually hardly spoke any English when she immigrated to the United States.
But she worked really hard, and she studied, and she earned her real estate license while she was waiting tables to support us.
Now, she likes to say that she's Flushing's top real estate broker.
She must be so proud of you.
Well, she knows that I'm passionate about what I do, and she's always wanted that for me.
Well, your mother's very openminded, not like here, where parents are obsessed with shaping the life of their children.
I'll be out in a minute.
Rachel, it was lovely meeting you.
She takes a little minute to warm up,  but we'll get there.
I'm so glad you could make it.
Astrid. So good to see a face I know.
So I see you've already met Princess Astrid and her little soldier toyboy, Mikey.
You know, Mikey is a bigshot tech startup guy.
So if you forget your password, he's your man.
So you're from the Taiwan plastic Chus, right?
Can I punch him in the face?
I'll be in my usual corner.
So, have you prepped Rachel to face the wolves?
She lectures millennials for a living.
I think she'll manage our family.
So you're not from a Taiwan Chu family?
I'm gonna stop you there because I'm gonna take her on the rounds.
This is Auntie Alix and Auntie Felicity.
It's so nice to meet you.
I've never been to a tan hua party before.
We love any excuse to throw a soiree.
Do your parents like to entertain?
One of my parents' oldest friends.
I actually met Nick's father at Cambridge.
So, what line of work is your father in?
Oh, my father died before I was born.
But he was a factory worker in China.
This is Ling Cheh, my old nanny.
Look, now's the time we need all hands on deck.
Please, please, just do me this favor.
You know if you need bodies at the office, I could always come in and help out.
The glamorous Astrid Leong  working as an assistant?
Wait, isn't Araminta's bachelorette party tomorrow?
And this will be the perfect excuse to get out of it.
I forgot to get you a fork.
Michael, I think it's the office.
Oh, my God! Nick, I can't believe I just did that.
It's fine. I don't think anybody even noticed.
I think I freaked out your nanny...
It's fine, don't worry about it.
Can I have a tissue please?
I heard you thought Ah Ma was the cook!
On the bright side, you're the talk of the party.
It's very disco Cleopatra, but in a good way.
That's exactly what I was going for.
So, Oliver, are you a cousin, too?
Mmm. Well, I'm one of the poorer relations.
The rainbow sheep of the family.
Whatever the Youngs want, I procure.
Why would they want to buy a rare Cambodian gong?
Ah Ma insists all your clothes be washed and pressed every two weeks.
Everything is exactly as I left it.
I had them thrown out years ago.
Never could get anything past you, could I?
I keep telling Ah Ma to put your things away, but she says this room makes her feel like you're still here.
Well, I got an earful when you didn't move back last year.
Your father and I were really looking forward to having you home.
With you onboard, maybe he'll take a day off once in a while.
There's things in New York that I wanna see through.
Well, I'm happy I finally met Rachel.
I thought you might be excited that the first girl that I bring home is a Chinese professor.
You know, bringing her home, introducing her at a large family gathering, some people may say...
When there's something to say about Rachel and me, you'll be first to hear.
But some things I need to figure out on my own.
Is that an American accent I'm hearing?
The tan hua plants very rarely bloom, and even then only at night.
Their beauty is spectacular but fleeting.
Oh, someone forgot to wear a bra.
Kitty Pong. Cousin Alistair's latest flame. An actress.
Rumor is, she was in a porno.
Two Girls, One Cup of Noodles.
You know, I thought I would like that more than I did.
Is it just me or are people staring at me?
Nicki is Ah Ma's favorite, in line to inherit everything.
No surprise there when that's the competition.
Oh, speaking of the grande dame...
I've been looking all over for you.
You ready to meet my grandmother?
It's so nice having Nick back home.
When children are away from home too long, they forget who they are.
So, I'm gonna intro you to my posse.
We're flying to my mom's resort in Sumatra.
She's closed down the whole place just for us.
We're gonna have so much fun.
So you let Bernard Tai organize all of this?
The twins are in the house!
I'm so glad you made it!
It's easy to make a killer entrance when you come as a matching set.
You're a professor at NYU, right?
General counsel to the Young Family Corporation, actually.
Mmm. Nah. Just good, oldfashioned nepotism.
I grew up with Nick and Colin.
It's nice to meet you, Rachel Chu.
All I wanted was a weekend away with my boys.
Don't worry. It's gonna be great, whatever happens.
I don't think it will be.
Any asshole can plan a normal stag party.
To organize a party this massive...
You don't have to keep Rachel happy.
She's just lucky to be here.
So we're gonna pretend like that's not the truth?
Are we in some kind of fairy tale story that I don't know about?
Did you find a shoe at midnight and jump in a pumpkin?
Yo, I got so much shit about marrying Fiona, and her parents own the biggest shipping company in Hong Kong.
Hey, Araminta's adorable, but you think your dad would be spending millions on this wedding if her parents didn't own a billiondollar resort chain?
What's Rachel bringing to the table?
Hey. It's not worth it, man.
Hey, guys, this is boring. Massage time.
And you, the bachelor, you're gonna get one before this weekend is over.
Or we're gonna tie you up and shave your coo coo chara.
We have to get off this ship.
This weekend is about sisterhood and connecting with the divine in all of us.
So, I hope you'll all find your bliss, starting with an allpaid shopping spree at the fashion boutique!
But you have ping pong tits!
You keep what you can carry.
You keep what you can carry.
Yeah, no one loves free stuff more than rich people.
Just the one dress for you?
I don't wanna lose an arm.
Ooh. Well, in that case, one last touch.
Well, isn't Nick a lucky guy.
Guess that pilot's license came in handy after all.
Mmm. I think that is the best beer I've ever had.
I'm gonna have to agree with you on that.
You know, if it wasn't for Araminta, I'd ask you to marry me.
Although, there is a little something that might get in the way of that.
Nick, I'm really happy for you, man.
I think my masseuse just got me pregnant.
I can see why Nick put off coming back to Singapore.
You know, he was supposed to come back last year, take over the family business.
His parents freaked out when he didn't.
But, now that he's back, I'm sure all is forgiven.
But he's not back for good.
I mean, we're just here for a wedding.
No, I'm really happy for you.
Colin, I've known you since you were in nappies.
I know when there's something on your mind.
Well, it wasn't that long ago that you were sure you were moving back home.
And I mean, Rachel loves her job in New York.
Yeah, we're gonna figure that out.
You're going to figure it out. Right.
It's hard knowing where you stand with someone like Nicholas Young.
He has all that pressure from his family.
Not just in business, but in who he's dating.
It's like, you just never know what's quite going on in that gorgeous head of his.
Nick told you that we were together, right?
Although our families, particularly his mother, always wanted us to get married.
I guess we weren't ready then.
Dude, ever since primary school, you were always going to be the next chairman of the Young Corporation, your family's shining heir.
You really think your family's going to accept anything less than that?
Are you thinking of walking out?
Leaving everything to bloody Alistair and Eddie?
I'm not walking out on anything.
I met a girl, I fell in love and I want to marry her.
And it can't just be one thing or the other.
It takes guts coming all the way over here, facing Nick's family.
Especially when Eleanor isn't exactly in your corner.
Okay, your family aside, have you ever thought about what your relationship with Rachel will be like if you got married?
I mean, okay, you're Nicholas Young.
And if she becomes Mrs. Nicholas Young, every day for her is going to be a struggle.
I heard she told Tini that Nick is a good catch.
It's like she's never heard of plastic surgery.
You sure she's ready for that?
Let's just forget about those girls.
Camp out here and order room service?
I'm not gonna make a scene.
I'm not gonna give them the satisfaction.
This weekend was supposed to be manipedis, cocktails served in pineapples.
This definitely wasn't on the menu.
Why would Araminta even have friends like that?
Well, you grow up your whole lives together, you make excuses for people.
I mean, I know Michael didn't have to deal with catty, fishkilling sociopaths.
How did you two get through all this?
Well, I didn't have it quite as bad, but it wasn't pretty.
Well, at least tell me it gets better.
I thought I was here to meet your family, go to your best friend's wedding, eat some good food.
Instead, I feel like I'm a villain in a soap opera who's plotting to steal your family fortune.
She told me that everyone here thinks that I'm the evil person that prevented you from moving back to Singapore last year, when I didn't even know you were supposed to come home.
You have every reason to be upset.

There was also this gutted, bloody fish that Araminta's friends left for me in my hotel room on my bed next to the words, "Catch this, you golddigging bitch." Written in big, fat serialkiller letters.
I mean, please tell me that's all that happened.
I don't even care about those stupid girls with their stupid little designer handbags and sunglasses.
I don't care that your exgirlfriend told me all this crap.
It's that you didn't tell me any of it.
Why? Were you trying to test me?
When we first met, you had no idea who I was, who my family were.
Yeah, I don't care about that stupid stuff.
You are so different from all of the women that I grew up with.
And I love who I am around you.
I don't want that to change.
I'm sorry that you had to deal with that on your own.
Whatever happens, we'll get through it together.
You know what? We need to do something tonight.
We need to do something that's just you and me, okay?
But we do have to go make some dumplings first.
We can eat as many as you like.
We're hosting a rehearsal dinner, not feeding an army.
Better too many than have people say we're stingy.
You put the baby in bed.
You give him a kiss good night.
And then you eat the baby.
Then you eat the baby after he's cooked.
No, you gotta make sure he's cooked.
Did your Ah Ma teach you that?
I, on the other hand, was taught by GrandAuntie Mabel.
You put the Botox in the face, and then you pinch, pinch, pinch.
Did you guys all learn when you were kids?
We taught you so you'd know the blood, sweat, and tears it took to raise and feed you monkeys.
Not like the angmohs microwaving macaroni and cheese for their own children.
No wonder they put their parents in the old folks' home when they all grow up.
Ah Ma says if we don't pass traditions down like this, they'll disappear.
God forbid, we lose the ancient Chinese tradition of guilting your children.
Mother used to wait for me after school with a nice basket of these.
Hey, I never got afterschool dumplings.
Well, that's because Auntie Felicity was doing afterschool microdermabrasion.
It's just great seeing you guys all like this.
When I was growing up, it was just me and my mom, which I loved.
But we didn't really have a big family like this.
Oh, that's so lovely of you to say, Rachel.
We are all very lucky to have each other.
That's a beautiful ring, Auntie Eleanor.
I've never seen anything like it.
Nick's father had it made when he proposed to me.
They were both studying law together.
Oh, I didn't know you were a lawyer.
I withdrew from university when we got married.
I chose to help my husband run a business and to raise a family.
For me, it was a privilege.
But for you, you may think it's oldfashioned.
It's nice you appreciate this house and us being here together wrapping dumplings.
But all this doesn't just happen.
It's because we know to put family first, instead of chasing one's passion.
I think I'm a little lost.
I am afraid that I've been unfair.
I'm sorry I made an assumption.
I didn't mean to offend you.
The truth is Nick's father had it made when he wanted to propose to me because Ah Ma wouldn't give him the family ring.
I didn't come from the right family, have the right connections.
And Ah Ma thought I would not make an adequate wife to her son.
It took many years, and she had good reason to be concerned.
Because I had no idea the work and the sacrifice it would take.
There were many days when I wondered if I would ever measure up.
But having been through it all, I know this much.
I wouldn't want Nick to worry.
I know my mum can be tough at times, but there isn't anything she wouldn't do for me.
And there is a reason why I lived with Ah Ma growing up.
It's because my mother knew she wasn't the favorite.
So she let her raise me, so I would be.
But it's hard to understand from the outside.
But she did what she thought was best for the family.
Anyway, I think I've had enough with dumplings for the rest of my life.
Sushi, movies, anything you like. Really.
Was she like, "You will never be good enough for my son"?
"You will never be good enough for my son"?
Except for in a way that made me wanna cry and puke at the same time.
You know, I bet if you told her you'd leave Nick for a million dollars, she will write that check.
And she looked at me like I was nothing.
I feel like she would do that.
